goal.core.kr.language

Interface Substitution


  • public interface Substitution
    A substitution is a mapping of distinct variables to terms. A substitution is said to bind the term to the variable if it maps the variable to the term. A substitution may be empty.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBinding(Var var, Term term)
      Extends the substitution with a new binding for a variable.
      Substitution clone() 
      Substitution combine(Substitution substitution)
      Combines two substitutions.
      Term get(Var var)
      Returns the term to which the variable is bound, if any.

      Returns the set of Variables bound by this Substitution.
      boolean remove(Var var)
      Removes the binding to a variable from this Substitution.
      boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<Var> variables)
      Removes all Bindings in this Substitution that do not bind any of the given Vars.

    • Method Detail

      • getVariables

        java.util.Set<Var> getVariables()
        Returns the set of Variables bound by this Substitution.
        Returns:
        The variables in the domain of this substitution.

      • get

        Term get(Var var)
        Returns the term to which the variable is bound, if any.
        Parameters:
        var - variable for which a binding is searched for.
        Returns:
        term that is bound to variable in substitution, if such a binding exists, otherwise null.

      • addBinding

        void addBinding(Var var,
              Term term)
        Extends the substitution with a new binding for a variable. It first checks if variable has already been bound. If so, nothing happens, else new binding is added.
        Parameters:
        var - the variable.
        term - the binding.

      • combine

        Substitution combine(Substitution substitution)
        Combines two substitutions.
        Parameters:
        substitution - A substitution to be combined with this Substitution, or null (representing a failure to unify two terms).
        Returns:
        The substitution resulting from combining this Substitution with the parameter substitution. Returns null if both substitutions cannot be combined because they both have different bindings for one and the same variable; also returns null if the parameter substitution is equal to null.

      • remove

        boolean remove(Var var)
        Removes the binding to a variable from this Substitution. The result of this method is that this Substitution does not bind the given Var.
        Parameters:
        var - The variable to remove the Binding from.
        Returns:
        true iff the Var used to be bound by this Substitution.

      • retainAll

        boolean retainAll(java.util.Collection<Var> variables)
        Removes all Bindings in this Substitution that do not bind any of the given Vars.
        Parameters:
        variables - A super-set of the variables that should be bound by this substitution after this call.
        Returns:
        true if any binding was removed from this Substitution.

      • clone

        Substitution clone()
        Returns:
        A full copy of this Substitution
